data.text:
State Senate

4 year term beginning on the date of the general election

Note: The term of office for State Senators elected in 2020 for districts: 2, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 14, 15, 19, 20, 22, 25 is 2 years. All 25 State Senate seats are up for election in 2022 due to redistricting by the 2021 Reapportionment Commission. Since State Senate elections are staggered, the Reapportionment Commission will assign a 2-year term for 12 seats and a 4-year term for the other 13 seats. The 12 seats up for election in 2024 will resume the normal 4-year term going forward. (Hawaii State Constitution, Article IV, Sections 7 and 8)

*On January 19, 2021, State Senator Laura Acasio was appointed by Governor David Ige to fill a vacancy created upon the resignation of U.S. Representative Kaiali‘i Kahele.

**On June 17, 2021, State Senator Lynn P. DeCoite was appointed by Governor David Ige to fill a vacancy created upon the retirement of State Senator J. Kalani English.

***On June 18, 2020, a vacancy in the State Senate for District 16 was created by the death of State Senator Breene Harimoto. As the original term of office was to expire on November 8, 2022, an election was held with the regularly scheduled general election in 2020, to fill the remainder of the term.
